NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR (CNN) There have been many variations of the American flag throughout history, but only one that can lay claim to inspiring the national anthem. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR It was sewn together on the floor of a brewery and took 11 men to hoist up the flagpole. After a night of British bombardment, it still flew over Fort McHenry during the "dawn's early light" on September 14, 1814, as Francis Scott Key wrote in "The Star-Spangled Banner." MUST WATCH Donning a speedo for a history lesson NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR That was more than 200 years ago but our flag is still inspiring people like CNN's Mike Rowe to trace its history. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR So, what makes the American Flag so special? One word: Simplicity. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Ted Kaye, who literally wrote the book on good flag design titled "Good Flag, Bad Flag," says "flags should be so simple that a child can draw it from memory."
